Uses of Class
com.here.android.mpa.common.PositioningManager.LocationMethod

  • Packages that use PositioningManager.LocationMethod 
    Package Description
    com.here.android.mpa.common
    This package includes classes, interfaces, and enumerations that are generally used by other packages in the Android SDK.
    com.here.android.mpa.venues3d
    This package provides facilities to search and display objects representing three-dimensional views of venues.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Gets the status for a specified LocationMethod.
      boolean PositioningManager.hasValidPosition(PositioningManager.LocationMethod method)
      Determines whether the current position for the specified LocationMethod is valid.
      protected boolean LocationDataSource.isValidForMapMatching(PositioningManager.LocationMethod method, android.location.Location location)
      Can be called by the derived class to check if a location is valid for map matching.
      protected void LocationDataSource.onLocationUpdated(PositioningManager.LocationMethod method, android.location.Location location)
      Must be called by the derived class whenever the last known location is updated or the position fix has been lost.
      void PositioningManager.OnPositionChangedListener.onPositionFixChanged(PositioningManager.LocationMethod method, PositioningManager.LocationStatus status)
      A callback indicating that the position fix has changed.
      void PositioningManager.OnPositionChangedListener.onPositionUpdated(PositioningManager.LocationMethod method, GeoPosition position, boolean isMapMatched)
      A callback indicating that the position has been updated.
      protected void LocationDataSource.onStatusUpdated(PositioningManager.LocationMethod method, int status)
      Must be called by the derived class whenever the location status has been updated.
      abstract boolean LocationDataSource.start(PositioningManager.LocationMethod method)
      Called by PositioningManager to start location updates using the specified location method.
      boolean PositioningManager.start(PositioningManager.LocationMethod method)
      Starts receiving position updates from the current location data source.
